ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: The child makes eye contact with the caregiver - Degree of eye contact
Notes: 0 = Extremely; 1 = Very much; 2 = Quite a bit; 3 = Just a little; 4 = Not at all

ElementDescription: The child's actions are purposeful - Degree of purposeful action
Notes: 0 = Extremely; 1 = Very much; 2 = Quite a bit; 3 = Just a little; 4 = Not at all

ElementDescription: The child is aware of his/her surroundings - Degree of awareness
Notes: 0 = Extremely; 1 = Very much; 2 = Quite a bit; 3 = Just a little; 4 = Not at all

ElementDescription: The child is restless - Degree of restlessness
Notes: 0 = Extremely; 1 = Very much; 2 = Quite a bit; 3 = Just a little; 4 = Not at all

ElementDescription: The child is inconsolable - Degree of inconsolability
Notes: 0 = Extremely; 1 = Very much; 2 = Quite a bit; 3 = Just a little; 4 = Not at all

ElementDescription: The child makes eye contact with the caregiver - Description of eye contact
Notes: 0 = Maintains eye contact on own/looking around purposefully; 2 = Looks only when cued to look/able to focus when asked to do so; 4 = Not at all/unable to focus

ElementDescription: The child's actions are purposeful - Description of purposeful action
Notes: 0 = Acts to initiate movement, reaches, points, etc.; 2 = Reacts to stimuli, pushes people/things away, moves away, etc.; 4 = Not at all/movements have no purpose

ElementDescription: The child is aware of his/her surroundings - Description of awareness
Notes: 0 = Awake and alert appropriate; 2 = Can orient self if directed to do so/asked specific questions; 4 = Not at all/does not recognize caregiver, hospital, etc.

ElementDescription: The child is restless - Description of restlessness
Notes: 0 = Not at all/may be moving, but is calm; 2 = Moving about, but does not require restraint to stay safe; 4 = Requires restraint to maintain safety

ElementDescription: The child is inconsolable - Description of inconsolability
Notes: 0 = Not at all/no crying with minor distraction (voice, touch, etc.); 2 = Crying stops with major distraction (holding, rocking, play, etc.); 4 = Does not stop crying no matter what
